content.question: Which of the following intervals is played?

choices.label: The figure presents two half notes in bass clef. The pitches are F-sharp 3 and G3.
The figure presents two half notes in bass clef. The pitches are F-sharp 3 and G-sharp 3.
The figure presents two half notes in bass clef. The pitches are F-sharp 3 and E3.
The figure presents two half notes in bass clef. The pitches are F-sharp 3 and E-sharp 3.

content.answer: The figure presents two half notes in bass clef. The pitches are F-sharp 3 and G-sharp 3.

unit.text: 1: Music Fundamentals I - Pitch, Major Scales and Key Signatures, Rhythm, Meter, and Expressive Elements

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Use symbols and terms to describe features of pitch in performed music, including pitch patterns and relationships, melodic features, chords, harmonic progressions, and cadences.
